page.title: 17RELIGION
page.content: There are two Methodist Churches in the area but no Anglican Church. Part of the area is in Heatherycleugh Par- ish,served by the Church of St.Thomas at Cowshill which replaced the old church at Copt Hill in 1914, and part in the Parish of St.John in Weardale, served by the Church of St.John the Baptist rebuilt in 1752. The incumb- ent of both livings, together with St.Andrews,Westgate, lives at the Cowshill Vicarage. The Methodist Min- ister, whose circuit covers the same area, lives in the Westgate Manse. The Methodist Church of High House, built in Ireshopeburn in 1760, is of espec- ial interest because of its associa- tion with John Wesley and because it is the second oldest Methodist Church in England still in use. It has rec- ently been renovated as has Wearhead Methodist Church, built in 1826.
